(Topic Title: Jewish Immigrants & American Popular Culture: Song, Stage, and Screen)
(Course description: This course examines the relationship between American popular culture and Jewish immigrants from Eastern Europe (1880-1940s). It covers the rise of mass culture in the United States in the late nineteenth century through the post-immigrant era. Students will read novels, plays, and comics, listen to songs, and watch films, receiving a well-rounded grasp of how America shaped Jewish immigrants and how Jewish immigrants shaped America. The course will touch on themes of urbanization, migration, religious change, antisemitism, economic mobility, modern romance, print culture, and much more. The asynchronous elements of the course include short lectures, readings, and engagement with primary sources. The synchronous elements of the course include discussion and live analysis of primary sources)
